class.name: NavigationServer2D
class.brief_description: Server interface for low-level 2D navigation access.
class.description: NavigationServer2D is the server responsible for all 2D navigation. It handles several objects, namely maps, regions and agents. Maps are made up of regions, which are made of navigation polygons. Together, they define the navigable areas in the 2D world. [b]Note:[/b] Most NavigationServer changes take effect after the next physics frame and not immediately. This includes all changes made to maps, regions or agents by navigation related Nodes in the SceneTree or made through scripts. For two regions to be connected to each other, they must share a similar edge. An edge is considered connected to another if both of its two vertices are at a distance less than [code]edge_connection_margin[/code] to the respective other edge's vertex. You may assign navigation layers to regions with [method NavigationServer2D.region_set_navigation_layers], which then can be checked upon when requesting a path with [method NavigationServer2D.map_get_path]. This allows allowing or forbidding some areas to 2D objects. To use the collision avoidance system, you may use agents. You can set an agent's target velocity, then the servers will emit a callback with a modified velocity. [b]Note:[/b] The collision avoidance system ignores regions. Using the modified velocity as-is might lead to pushing and agent outside of a navigable area. This is a limitation of the collision avoidance system, any more complex situation may require the use of the physics engine. This server keeps tracks of any call and executes them during the sync phase. This means that you can request any change to the map, using any thread, without worrying.

method.name: agent_create
method.description: Creates the agent.

method.name: agent_get_map
method.description: Returns the navigation map [RID] the requested [param agent] is currently assigned to.

method.name: agent_is_map_changed
method.description: Returns true if the map got changed the previous frame.

method.name: agent_set_callback
method.description: Sets the callback that gets called after each avoidance processing step for the [param agent]. The calculated [code]safe_velocity[/code] will be passed as the first parameter just before the physics calculations. [b]Note:[/b] Created callbacks are always processed independently of the SceneTree state as long as the agent is on a navigation map and not freed. To disable the dispatch of a callback from an agent use [method agent_set_callback] again with an empty [Callable].

method.name: agent_set_map
method.description: Puts the agent in the map.

method.name: agent_set_max_neighbors
method.description: Sets the maximum number of other agents the agent takes into account in the navigation. The larger this number, the longer the running time of the simulation. If the number is too low, the simulation will not be safe.

method.name: agent_set_max_speed
method.description: Sets the maximum speed of the agent. Must be positive.

method.name: agent_set_neighbor_distance
method.description: Sets the maximum distance to other agents this agent takes into account in the navigation. The larger this number, the longer the running time of the simulation. If the number is too low, the simulation will not be safe.

method.name: agent_set_position
method.description: Sets the position of the agent in world space.

method.name: agent_set_radius
method.description: Sets the radius of the agent.

method.name: agent_set_target_velocity
method.description: Sets the new target velocity.

method.name: agent_set_time_horizon
method.description: The minimal amount of time for which the agent's velocities that are computed by the simulation are safe with respect to other agents. The larger this number, the sooner this agent will respond to the presence of other agents, but the less freedom this agent has in choosing its velocities. Must be positive.

method.name: agent_set_velocity
method.description: Sets the current velocity of the agent.

method.name: free_rid
method.description: Destroys the given RID.

method.name: get_debug_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] when the NavigationServer has debug enabled.

method.name: get_maps
method.description: Returns all created navigation map [RID]s on the NavigationServer. This returns both 2D and 3D created navigation maps as there is technically no distinction between them.

method.name: link_create
method.description: Create a new link between two positions on a map.

method.name: link_get_end_position
method.description: Returns the ending position of this [code]link[/code].

method.name: link_get_enter_cost
method.description: Returns the enter cost of this [param link].

method.name: link_get_map
method.description: Returns the navigation map [RID] the requested [code]link[/code] is currently assigned to.

method.name: link_get_navigation_layers
method.description: Returns the navigation layers for this [code]link[/code].

method.name: link_get_owner_id
method.description: Returns the [code]ObjectID[/code] of the object which manages this link.

method.name: link_get_start_position
method.description: Returns the starting position of this [code]link[/code].

method.name: link_get_travel_cost
method.description: Returns the travel cost of this [param link].

method.name: link_is_bidirectional
method.description: Returns whether this [code]link[/code] can be travelled in both directions.

method.name: link_set_bidirectional
method.description: Sets whether this [code]link[/code] can be travelled in both directions.

method.name: link_set_end_position
method.description: Sets the exit position for the [code]link[/code].

method.name: link_set_enter_cost
method.description: Sets the [code]enter_cost[/code] for this [code]link[/code].

method.name: link_set_map
method.description: Sets the navigation map [RID] for the link.

method.name: link_set_navigation_layers
method.description: Set the links's navigation layers. This allows selecting links from a path request (when using [method NavigationServer2D.map_get_path]).

method.name: link_set_owner_id
method.description: Set the [code]ObjectID[/code] of the object which manages this link.

method.name: link_set_start_position
method.description: Sets the entry position for this [code]link[/code].

method.name: link_set_travel_cost
method.description: Sets the [code]travel_cost[/code] for this [code]link[/code].

method.name: map_create
method.description: Create a new map.

method.name: map_force_update
method.description: This function immediately forces synchronization of the specified navigation [param map] [RID]. By default navigation maps are only synchronized at the end of each physics frame. This function can be used to immediately (re)calculate all the navigation meshes and region connections of the navigation map. This makes it possible to query a navigation path for a changed map immediately and in the same frame (multiple times if needed). Due to technical restrictions the current NavigationServer command queue will be flushed. This means all already queued update commands for this physics frame will be executed, even those intended for other maps, regions and agents not part of the specified map. The expensive computation of the navigation meshes and region connections of a map will only be done for the specified map. Other maps will receive the normal synchronization at the end of the physics frame. Should the specified map receive changes after the forced update it will update again as well when the other maps receive their update. Avoidance processing and dispatch of the [code]safe_velocity[/code] signals is untouched by this function and continues to happen for all maps and agents at the end of the physics frame. [b]Note:[/b] With great power comes great responsibility. This function should only be used by users that really know what they are doing and have a good reason for it. Forcing an immediate update of a navigation map requires locking the NavigationServer and flushing the entire NavigationServer command queue. Not only can this severely impact the performance of a game but it can also introduce bugs if used inappropriately without much foresight.

method.name: map_get_agents
method.description: Returns all navigation agents [RID]s that are currently assigned to the requested navigation [param map].

method.name: map_get_cell_size
method.description: Returns the map cell size.

method.name: map_get_closest_point
method.description: Returns the point closest to the provided [param to_point] on the navigation mesh surface.

method.name: map_get_closest_point_owner
method.description: Returns the owner region RID for the point returned by [method map_get_closest_point].

method.name: map_get_edge_connection_margin
method.description: Returns the edge connection margin of the map. The edge connection margin is a distance used to connect two regions.

method.name: map_get_link_connection_radius
method.description: Returns the link connection radius of the map. This distance is the maximum range any link will search for navigation mesh polygons to connect to.

method.name: map_get_links
method.description: Returns all navigation link [RID]s that are currently assigned to the requested navigation [code]map[/code].

method.name: map_get_path
method.description: Returns the navigation path to reach the destination from the origin. [param navigation_layers] is a bitmask of all region navigation layers that are allowed to be in the path.

method.name: map_get_regions
method.description: Returns all navigation regions [RID]s that are currently assigned to the requested navigation [param map].

method.name: map_is_active
method.description: Returns true if the map is active.

method.name: map_set_active
method.description: Sets the map active.

method.name: map_set_cell_size
method.description: Set the map cell size used to weld the navigation mesh polygons.

method.name: map_set_edge_connection_margin
method.description: Set the map edge connection margin used to weld the compatible region edges.

method.name: map_set_link_connection_radius
method.description: Set the map's link connection radius used to connect links to navigation polygons.

method.name: query_path
method.description: Queries a path in a given navigation map. Start and target position and other parameters are defined through [NavigationPathQueryParameters2D]. Updates the provided [NavigationPathQueryResult2D] result object with the path among other results requested by the query.

method.name: region_create
method.description: Creates a new region.

method.name: region_get_connection_pathway_end
method.description: Returns the ending point of a connection door. [param connection] is an index between 0 and the return value of [method region_get_connections_count].

method.name: region_get_connection_pathway_start
method.description: Returns the starting point of a connection door. [param connection] is an index between 0 and the return value of [method region_get_connections_count].

method.name: region_get_connections_count
method.description: Returns how many connections this [param region] has with other regions in the map.

method.name: region_get_enter_cost
method.description: Returns the enter cost of this [param region].

method.name: region_get_map
method.description: Returns the navigation map [RID] the requested [param region] is currently assigned to.

method.name: region_get_navigation_layers
method.description: Returns the region's navigation layers.

method.name: region_get_owner_id
method.description: Returns the [code]ObjectID[/code] of the object which manages this region.

method.name: region_get_travel_cost
method.description: Returns the travel cost of this [param region].

method.name: region_owns_point
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the provided [param point] in world space is currently owned by the provided navigation [param region]. Owned in this context means that one of the region's navigation mesh polygon faces has a possible position at the closest distance to this point compared to all other navigation meshes from other navigation regions that are also registered on the navigation map of the provided region. If multiple navigation meshes have positions at equal distance the navigation region whose polygons are processed first wins the ownership. Polygons are processed in the same order that navigation regions were registered on the NavigationServer. [b]Note:[/b] If navigation meshes from different navigation regions overlap (which should be avoided in general) the result might not be what is expected.

method.name: region_set_enter_cost
method.description: Sets the [param enter_cost] for this [param region].

method.name: region_set_map
method.description: Sets the map for the region.

method.name: region_set_navigation_layers
method.description: Set the region's navigation layers. This allows selecting regions from a path request (when using [method NavigationServer2D.map_get_path]).

method.name: region_set_navigation_polygon
method.description: Sets the [param navigation_polygon] for the region.

method.name: region_set_owner_id
method.description: Set the [code]ObjectID[/code] of the object which manages this region.

method.name: region_set_transform
method.description: Sets the global transformation for the region.

method.name: region_set_travel_cost
method.description: Sets the [param travel_cost] for this [param region].

method.name: set_debug_enabled
method.description: If [code]true[/code] enables debug mode on the NavigationServer.

signal.name: map_changed
signal.description: Emitted when a navigation map is updated, when a region moves or is modified.

signal.name: navigation_debug_changed
signal.description: Emitted when navigation debug settings are changed. Only available in debug builds.
